--- title: CircuitPython_pico_pi_controller keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: "The `pico_pi_controller` module contains CircuitPython classes to manage multiple Raspberry Pi SBCs from a Raspberry Pi Pico, using i2c." description: "The `pico_pi_controller` module contains CircuitPython classes to manage multiple Raspberry Pi SBCs from a Raspberry Pi Pico, using i2c." nb_path: "00_core.ipynb" ---
{% raw %}
{% endraw %}

About

Controller programs may be written with a hard-coded I2C peripheral addresses of the primary connected SBC, aka 'bosmang' . Autodiscovery may then be used so that devices may be added without changing software on the controller.

For example:

import pico_pi_controller as PPC

mycontroller = PPC.PPController(0x13)

mycontroller.addDevice('0x13')
mycontroller.listdevices()

This example will initialize I2C on the controller using the board defaults (I2C bus 1), retrieve host information & statistics from the SBC at I2C address 0x13, then return a list of device information.

Broadcom SoC hardware I2C is utilized both for the controlling MCU (the Pico) and the controlled SBCs (Raspberry Pi 4/3+/Zero). I2C baudrate is limited from the controller (the Pico) to reduce transmit/receive errors.

Module

{% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class UNDevice[source]

UNDevice(controller, device_address)

Represents an I2C peripheral device unidentified to a PPController

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class PPDevice[source]

PPDevice(controller, device_address)

Represents an I2C peripheral device identified as a PPDevice and stores data from those hosts.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class PPController[source]

PPController(**kwargs)

Represents one of the system's I2C busses and tracks which I2C peripherals are PPDevices.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

PPController.i2c_scan[source]

PPController.i2c_scan()

Scans the I2C bus and creates I2CDevice objects for each I2C peripheral.

PPController.idf_ppds[source]

PPController.idf_ppds()

Identifies PPDs from among all unidentified I2C peripherals. I2CDevice objects for non-PPD I2C peripherals are eventually discared.

PPController.add_ppds[source]

PPController.add_ppds()

This class is a wrapper for i2c_scan + idf_ppds.

PPController.qry_ppds[source]

PPController.qry_ppds(ppds=None)

Queries PPDs for their essential metadata & stats; queries all by default. Updates bosmang status if setting not locked on controller. Note that certain PPD metadata, once set, can be changed only via command.

PPController.png_ppds[source]

PPController.png_ppds(ppds=None, register_names=None)

Pings PPDs for queued commands, register values; pings all PPDs by default, or a list of ppds, in both cases starting with bosmang.

PPController.get_ppd[source]

PPController.get_ppd(device_address=None, hostname=None)

Get a PPDevice object by device_address or hostname.
